review_title: Great environment for mentorship + great pay for students!
job_title: Student Laboratory Assistant in New York, NY
pros:
- Willing to teach many new skills

cons: The only con is that it is a very demanding job but worth every minute! The experience I received at MMC's Natural Sciences Department is unparalleled!

job_title: Administrative Coordinator in New York, NY

cons: Raises are difficult for staff, college could work on transparency for staff who are student facing when issues and changes arise

review_title: Wonderful place to work. Too bad its so hard to get permanent full-time employment

job_title: Director in New York, NY
pros: the students, some staff, the creative environment, autonomy to do your job

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in New York, NY
pros: Students are lovely and you can design your class

job_title: Purchasing Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Welcoming Community, Friendly Colleagues, Cool Events

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: It's a small college so most of the staff knows each other well, and much of upper management is accessible. Goals for diversity, inclusivity, and betterment of the college are great; on paper this place is a sparkling progressive safe-haven. The education is quality, and faculty are well-respected and very generous with their time and talent. Many of the students are bright, passionate, and an asset to the community.
cons: Many of the goals are not fulfilled because of disagreements between Deans, Vice Presidents, etc. There is a lot of resistance to the new President from certain older, veteran members of the upper management. Many offices are chronically understaffed, and adjuncts are paid an at an embarrassingly low rate. The financial aid office is a disorganized disaster, and IT can't type its way out of a paper bag. Communication between departments is abysmal, and the gossip mill is constantly churning.

job_title: Admissions Counselor in New York, NY
pros: Friendly atmosphere. Helpful administration and colleagues. Nice area. Good benefits. Flexible employers.
cons: Extremely archaic systems from the crm system to the amount of paper waste. There weren't even air dryers in the bathroom. MMC is really not anywhere near a green standard and this paper reliance allows for a lot of mistakes to fall through the cracks. Files are lost and things like reimbursement or expense reports are being lost in the shuffle.

review_title: It hasn't always been easy but overall it's been a positive experience.
job_title: in New York, NY
pros: I have more decision-making power than I've ever had at any job.  The benefits are good; the time off is very good, particularly with Summer Fridays.  It's so small, you get to know fellow employees very quickly, which can be beneficial in doing your job.
cons: Most of the faculty are so narcissistic, they make it difficult to work with them.  Although this is true for most colleges, MM feels like it's the worst.  It's a predominantly white school both in students and employees and there doesn't seem to be an interest in changing that except for a few people. There are some customer service problems years old and still don't get fixed.

review_title: You gotta love your job to stay here
job_title: Administrative Assistant to Vice-President in New York, NY
pros: Great location, regular hours, non-supervisory staff is often good young folks, vibrant atmosphere.
cons:
Departments have little communication with each other. You could easy work there for a year and not know anybody outside your office.
Some departments often feel very disconnected from the students - which is what the school is about.
Because the school is so small its easy to forget its actually a college.
Too often complaints that alumni that they were treated as walking dollar bills not people.
Too much micromanaging my supervisors leading to high turn-over, disgruntled employees, not listening to employees, inability to change with circumstances and a lot of back-stabbing

review_title: Small school feel, private university problems
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: MMC is a nice small-knit community. Friendly staff members, budding students and nice building. Good HR department as well as cafeteria. In regards to my office, most of the people were supportive and efficient.
cons: Management was very poor. My supervisor micromanaged and spoke poorly to their respective staff in almost a inhumane way. Nothing was done about that. Communication across the various offices and departments was very weak. Not much room for advancement.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Friendly coworkers, Fridays off in summers, week off between Christmas and New Years, generous with vacation and personal days, 10% retirement contribution without required match after one year
cons: No merit based raises and standard raises below inflation. Management don't seem to care about staff. There have been efforts to reduce benefits and eliminate raises all together which is causing the best staff to leave. Things have been getting worse and worse.

review_title: Overall a great place to learn!
job_title: Counselor in New York, NY
pros: I was able to really build up my resumes in the amount of work I was given. New projects and college wide initiatives included my office, which meant I was very hands-on with the brainstorming. I was also able to run with most ideas that I had.
cons: Lack of supervision of Assistant Directors, Directors, etc. of different departments by the college leadership. Small college means you can't really move up.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Great location on the Upper East Side of Manhattan.  Motivated and talented students.  Free access to all theatre productions.  Small size school.
cons: Not a lot of collaboration/communication between departments.  Sometimes it seems that leadership is a bit confused.

job_title: Work Study in New York, NY
pros: Worked in business department, the management was good about allowing a place for growth and improvement.
cons: The school does not support the division as much as it fully should so improvements are needed to improve the department.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in New York, NY
pros: A very friendly place, with great students.
cons: Salaries are very low for Manhattan, faculty work all the time and have a hard time surviving on their salaries. There is no place for research,  a very high teaching load and a lot of service. Corporate feel. Administration is very slow, benefits are not good.

job_title: Junior Financial Analyst in New York, NY
pros: Small, it is very easy to build rapport with people in various departments. You can work independently without people breathing down your back constantly.
cons: Company has a very eerie culture, not very accepting to multiple personalities. If you are different/disliked, you will be disposed of in the most gruesome of ways.

review_title: I loved my role at MMC!
job_title: Development As in New York, NY
pros:
- Great location in NYC
- Summer Fridays off and week off between Christmas and New Years
- Access to great student groups and performances
cons:
- The union seems, on the surface, to do more harm than good for employees
- Very limited vacation time
- Frequent staff turnover

job_title: in New York, NY
pros: Great friendly staff, small family environment, everyone contributes equally and cares about the goal
cons: might have to work a few weekends a year without much option, but thats worth it in the end

review_title: Tough but solid place to work

job_title: Executive Assistant in New York, NY

cons: Academic politics much harsher than corporate politics

job_title: Admissions Counselor in New York, NY

cons: Little room for growth.  Travel season can be taxing

job_title: Media Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: The staff community is warm and welcoming. The Union benefits and retirement plan are well planned out.
cons: My salary is too low

review_title: Flexible, Easy Job for College Student
